name: System Snapshot Webserver
tagline: {Collect the computer and system info at a given time in order to track issues or problems.}
body:
# System Snapshot Webserver.
Collect the computer and system info at a given time in order to track issues or problems.
You can share the generated report to help you detect your computer problem at a given moment.
Works on **Windows** / **Linux** OS. 

### Screen shoots
![Main Page](http://b21i.imgup.net/1dcdc.jpg)
![2 Page](http://r17i.imgup.net/211bf.jpg)
![3 Page](http://n58i.imgup.net/32548.jpg)
![4 Page](http://n58i.imgup.net/32548.jpg)
![5 Page](http://n06i.imgup.net/49215.jpg)
![6 Page](http://d53i.imgup.net/52da0.jpg)
![test](http://i26i.imgup.net/logo0a57.png)

http://b21i.imgup.net/1dcdc.jpg

### What kind of **Reports**
1. System Info
2. Hardware
3. Networks
4. PnP Devices
5. Processes
6. Services
7. Benchmark
8. Installed programs
9. Special files

### How to use
Run program (.exe) as Administrator.
Wait util report gets generated.
Open or send the report to someone who can read it and analyse or problem.

Note: Program can be executed with '-s', '/s' or '--silent' argument to skip GUI.
Report will be generated and the html file will show on explorer after completion. 

Example: "SystemInfoSnapshot.exe -s"
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
